TopicTitle: A quick building tip I just thought of

Articles.Content:
So I was putting some Goliath engines on FAT-455 wings and they didn't place straight, so I went into rotate mode with angle snap off, lined it up by sight, then switched to offset and toggled between local and absolute to see how far off I was.  After that I rotated it one notch at a time with no angle snap until there was no difference between local and absolute offset modes.

 

Hope that helps, happy building!

Good tip, thanks!

What I do is I change to rotate mode, go to absolute, set 90° as an angle and click.
